metadata.optimized_for: High volatility cryptocurrency markets (meme coins, altcoins)

strategies.name: RSI Momentum Divergence
entry_conditions: Price makes lower low while RSI(14) makes higher low (bullish divergence)
RSI crosses above 40 from oversold territory
exit_conditions: Price closes below entry candle low
strategies.why_works_volatile: Divergences in high volatility often signal exhaustion of irrational selling, allowing traders to capture sharp reversals before the crowd recognizes the shift.

strategies.name: MACD Histogram Acceleration
entry_conditions: MACD(12,26,9) histogram turns positive and expanding
Signal line crossed above zero within last 3 candles
exit_conditions: MACD histogram contracts for 2 consecutive bars
MACD line crosses below signal line
strategies.why_works_volatile: Accelerating histogram momentum in volatile markets captures explosive moves early, as crypto assets often exhibit strong momentum persistence once initiated.

strategies.name: Stochastic Momentum Burst
entry_conditions: Both lines turn upward with slope > 5 degrees

risk_management.time_stop: Exit after 8 periods if no profit

strategies.why_works_volatile: Stochastic crossovers from extreme levels in volatile crypto markets frequently precede rapid price expansions as momentum traders pile in.

strategies.name: Rate of Change (ROC) Surge
entry_conditions: ROC(12) crosses above zero with value > 5%
strategies.why_works_volatile: ROC measures velocity directly; in crypto's explosive moves, early ROC surges identify breakouts before they become obvious to retail traders.

strategies.name: Awesome Oscillator Saucer
entry_conditions: Awesome Oscillator histogram forms saucer pattern (3 bars: negative, less negative, positive)
exit_conditions: AO prints red bar after 3+ consecutive green bars
Price breaks below last swing low
strategies.why_works_volatile: The saucer pattern identifies momentum accumulation periods; in volatile crypto markets, these often precede violent upward moves as buying pressure builds.

strategies.name: CMO Zero Line Cross
entry_conditions: Chande Momentum Oscillator(14) crosses above zero
CMO was below -20 within last 5 periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: CMO's calculation using up/down days makes it responsive to crypto's violent swings, catching trend changes faster than RSI in volatile conditions.

strategies.name: Price Momentum Cross
entry_conditions: Price closes above highest high of last 10 periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: Pure price momentum strategies excel in crypto as breakouts tend to run further than traditional markets due to FOMO and limited liquidity.

strategies.name: Williams %R Reversal Burst
entry_conditions: Price closes above open of entry candle
exit_conditions: Price makes lower low than entry candle
strategies.why_works_volatile: Williams %R's sensitivity to closing prices captures crypto's rapid intraday reversals, ideal for scalping volatile meme coins.

strategies.name: TRIX Momentum Filter
entry_conditions: TRIX value turns positive from negative territory
Price above EMA(30) for trend confirmation
strategies.why_works_volatile: TRIX's triple smoothing reduces noise while maintaining responsiveness, perfect for filtering genuine momentum from crypto's choppy price action.

strategies.name: Ultimate Oscillator Combo
exit_conditions: UO turns down while price makes new high
strategies.why_works_volatile: UO's multi-timeframe construction reduces false signals in volatile crypto markets where single-period oscillators frequently whipsaw.

strategies.name: Bollinger Band Mean Reversion
entry_conditions: Price touches or closes below lower Bollinger Band(20,2)
exit_conditions: Price reaches middle Bollinger Band (20-period SMA)
Stop loss at 1.5x band width below entry

risk_management.take_profit: At middle band (50%) and upper band (50%)

strategies.why_works_volatile: Crypto's extreme volatility frequently pushes prices to statistical extremes; Bollinger Bands identify these overextensions that tend to revert quickly.

strategies.name: RSI Extreme Reversal
entry_conditions: RSI forms higher low while price makes lower low
Bullish engulfing or hammer candlestick pattern
exit_conditions: Price closes below entry candle low
strategies.why_works_volatile: RSI extremes below 20 occur frequently in crypto selloffs; these panic-driven drops create high-probability mean reversion opportunities.

strategies.name: Percent Price Oscillator (PPO) Reversion
exit_conditions: Price closes below recent swing low

risk_management.time_exit: Close after 6 periods if target not hit

strategies.why_works_volatile: PPO's percentage-based calculation adapts to crypto's varying price scales, effectively identifying oversold conditions across all market caps.

strategies.name: Commodity Channel Index (CCI) Oversold Bounce
entry_conditions: Price shows bullish hammer or doji at support
exit_conditions: Price fails to make new high for 3 periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: CCI's unbounded nature makes it ideal for crypto's extreme moves; readings below -200 capture true panic selling with high reversal probability.

strategies.name: Linear Regression Channel Reversion
entry_conditions: Price touches or breaks below lower regression channel (2 std dev)

risk_management.stop_loss: Below 2.5 standard deviations from regression line

strategies.why_works_volatile: Linear regression channels adapt to crypto's trending nature while identifying statistical extremes; prices rarely stay beyond 2 standard deviations for long.

strategies.name: Detrended Price Oscillator (DPO) Cycle
entry_conditions: Cycle low identified in last 5 periods

risk_management.cycle_confirmation: Use at least 3 cycle periods for validation

strategies.why_works_volatile: DPO removes trend to expose cycles; crypto's volatile nature creates pronounced short-term cycles perfect for this oscillator-based approach.

strategies.name: Relative Vigor Index (RVI) Reversion
entry_conditions: RVI signal line crosses above RVI
Price at support level with bullish candlestick
strategies.why_works_volatile: RVI measures conviction of closes relative to opens; extreme readings in volatile crypto markets signal exhaustion of buying/selling pressure.

strategies.name: Money Flow Index (MFI) Divergence
entry_conditions: Bullish divergence: price lower low, MFI higher low
strategies.why_works_volatile: MFI incorporates volume with RSI calculation; in crypto where volume precedes price, MFI divergences signal true accumulation before price reversal.

strategies.name: Envelope Band Snap Back
entry_conditions: Price closes below lower envelope (SMA 20, 2.5% offset)

risk_management.re_entry: Allow one re-entry if stopped but RSI still <20

strategies.why_works_volatile: Envelope bands use percentage offsets perfect for crypto's varying prices; wide 2.5% settings capture meme coin washouts with high snap-back probability.

strategies.name: Standard Error Channel Reversion
entry_conditions: Price at or below -2 standard error channel
At least 3 touches of lower channel in last 20 periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: Standard error channels measure trend reliability; prices outside 2 SE represent extreme deviations that statistically revert in volatile crypto markets.

strategies.name: Donchian Channel Breakout
entry_conditions: Price closes above upper Donchian Channel(20)
exit_conditions: Price closes below middle Donchian line (10-period average)
Price breaks below lower Donchian Channel
strategies.why_works_volatile: Donchian channels capture the essence of volatility breakouts; in crypto, 20-period highs often signal continuation of explosive moves driven by momentum.

strategies.name: Bollinger Squeeze Breakout
entry_conditions: Bands begin expanding (current width > previous width)
Price breaks above upper band with volume > 1.5x average

risk_management.take_profit: Scale 50% at 1:2, hold 50% with trailing stop

strategies.why_works_volatile: Bollinger squeezes precede volatility explosions; in crypto, these consolidation periods often resolve with 10-20% moves perfect for capture.

strategies.name: Keltner Channel Breakout
entry_conditions: Price closes above upper Keltner Channel(20,2)

risk_management.pyramid_rule: Add on each new ATR(14) increment above entry

strategies.why_works_volatile: Keltner Channels use ATR for band calculation, dynamically adapting to crypto's changing volatility and capturing true breakouts from noise.

strategies.name: Aroon Breakout System
exit_conditions: Aroon Up crosses below Aroon Down
strategies.why_works_volatile: Aroon measures time since highs/lows, making it responsive to crypto's rapid trend changes and early in detecting breakout initiation.

strategies.name: Volume Profile Breakout
entry_conditions: Price breaks above Volume POC (Point of Control) with volume
Price clears high volume node resistance
exit_conditions: Price reaches next high volume node above

risk_management.volume_confirmation: Require 2x average volume for valid breakout

strategies.why_works_volatile: Volume Profile reveals where substantial positions were built; breaking from these zones in volatile crypto markets triggers cascading moves.

strategies.name: Rectangle Consolidation Break
entry_conditions: Price in horizontal range for 10+ periods
Break above range high with volume confirmation
exit_conditions: Price reaches 1.5x range height above breakout

risk_management.false_breakout_filter: Require close above, not just wick

strategies.why_works_volatile: Crypto's volatile nature creates sharp, brief consolidations; rectangle breaks often lead to measured moves that exceed traditional market expectations.

strategies.name: ATR Volatility Breakout
entry_conditions: Close in upper 25% of candle range
exit_conditions: Price closes below entry candle midpoint
Trailing stop at 1.5 ATR from high
strategies.why_works_volatile: ATR-based entries adapt to crypto's changing volatility; large range candles signal institutional participation and likely trend continuation.

strategies.name: Parabolic SAR Acceleration
entry_conditions: Price above EMA(50) for trend alignment
SAR dots accelerating (increasing gap between dots)
strategies.why_works_volatile: Parabolic SAR's acceleration factor captures crypto's parabolic moves; the indicator adapts to speed of price change, ideal for explosive breakouts.

strategies.name: Ascending Triangle Break
entry_conditions: Break above horizontal resistance with volume > 1.5x
exit_conditions: Price reaches measured move target (triangle height + breakout)
Time exit after 10 periods if no momentum
strategies.why_works_volatile: Ascending triangles show accumulation; in crypto, these patterns have high completion rates and often produce explosive upside when volume confirms.

strategies.name: Chandelier Exit Breakout
entry_conditions: Price breaks above Chandelier Exit(22,3) line
exit_conditions: Price closes below Chandelier Exit line

risk_management.stop_loss: Chandelier Exit line acts as dynamic stop
risk_management.multiplier_adjustment: Use 2.5 ATR for less volatile pairs

strategies.why_works_volatile: Chandelier Exit combines highest high with ATR; perfect for crypto breakouts where volatility-based stops adapt to rapid price expansions.

strategies.name: 1-Minute VWAP Scalp
entry_conditions: Price crosses above VWAP on 1M chart

risk_management.time_exit: Close after 3 minutes if target not hit

strategies.why_works_volatile: 1-minute VWAP scalping exploits crypto's micro-volatility; rapid price oscillations around VWAP create frequent 0.5-1% profit opportunities.

strategies.name: EMA Cross Scalping
entry_conditions: EMA(8) crosses above EMA(21) on 5M chart
strategies.why_works_volatile: Fast EMA crosses on low timeframes capture crypto's rapid intraday momentum shifts; volatility creates more crossover signals with sufficient follow-through.

strategies.name: RSI Micro-Reversal
entry_conditions: RSI(5) drops below 15 on 1M or 5M chart
RSI turns up with bullish candle
strategies.why_works_volatile: Ultra-short RSI periods capture crypto's micro-fluctuations; extreme readings below 15 occur frequently in volatile conditions offering quick reversals.

strategies.name: Order Block Scalping
entry_conditions: Price returns to bullish order block (3+ consecutive up candles)
Price within upper 50% of order block range
Momentum shift candle (engulfing or pin bar)
exit_conditions: Price breaks below order block low
strategies.why_works_volatile: Order blocks represent institutional accumulation zones; in crypto's volatile markets, these zones act as magnets for price and offer high-probability scalping setups.

strategies.name: Range Scalping
entry_conditions: Price at lower end of established 1-2% range
strategies.why_works_volatile: Crypto's volatile periods are interspersed with brief consolidation ranges; scalping these ranges captures predictable oscillations before next expansion.

strategies.name: Bid-Ask Imbalance Scalp
entry_conditions: Order book shows 2:1 bid/ask ratio at support
Large limit orders appear on bid side (>5x average)
Price bouncing off visible liquidity wall
exit_conditions: Bid/ask ratio inverts to favor asks
Large liquidity wall gets eaten through
strategies.why_works_volatile: Order book imbalances reveal immediate buying/selling pressure; in crypto's volatile markets, these imbalances create predictable 0.3-0.5% moves.

strategies.name: Heikin Ashi Trend Scalp
entry_conditions: Heikin Ashi candle turns green after 3+ red candles
No lower wick on HA candle (strong buying)
exit_conditions: HA candle with upper wick appears
strategies.why_works_volatile: Heikin Ashi smooths price action, filtering noise in crypto's volatile markets; clear color changes signal micro-trend shifts ideal for scalping.

strategies.name: ATR Trailing Scalp
exit_conditions: Trailing stop hit (1.5 ATR from peak)

risk_management.take_profit: Let winners run with 1.5 ATR trail

strategies.why_works_volatile: ATR trailing stops adapt dynamically to crypto's changing volatility, capturing extended moves while protecting profits during sudden reversals.

strategies.name: CVD (Cumulative Volume Delta) Scalp
entry_conditions: CVD rising while price flat or rising (buying pressure)
Price at support with bullish candlestick
strategies.why_works_volatile: CVD reveals aggressive buyers vs sellers; in crypto's volatile environment, volume delta divergences predict price moves before they appear on charts.

strategies.name: Pivot Point Scalping
entry_conditions: Price bounces off S1 or S2 pivot level
exit_conditions: Price closes below entry pivot level
strategies.why_works_volatile: Pivot points create predictable support/resistance zones; in crypto's intraday volatility, these levels attract price action offering structured scalp setups.

strategies.name: Golden Cross Trend Following
exit_conditions: MACD histogram turns negative for 3+ periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: Golden Crosses in crypto often signal major trend shifts lasting weeks; the strategy captures the explosive early phase of trending markets.

strategies.name: Supertrend Following

risk_management.pyramid: Add 50% on each new Supertrend confirmation

strategies.why_works_volatile: Supertrend adapts ATR-based stops to volatility; perfect for crypto's trending periods where prices can move 20-50% in days.

strategies.name: ADX Trend Strength
strategies.why_works_volatile: ADX measures trend strength independent of direction; in crypto, ADX > 25 often precedes violent directional moves worth following.

strategies.name: Ichimoku Cloud Trend
entry_conditions: Chikou span(26) above price from 26 periods ago
Future Kumo bullish (Senkou Span A > B)

risk_management.stop_loss: Kijun-sen level or bottom of Kumo
risk_management.cloud_filter: Only enter when price > 10% above Kumo for strong trend

strategies.why_works_volatile: Ichimoku filters noise by requiring multiple confirmations; in crypto's volatile markets, this prevents whipsaws while capturing major trends.

strategies.name: Moving Average Ribbon
entry_conditions: All EMAs aligned: EMA(8) > EMA(13) > EMA(21) > EMA(55)
Price pulls back to EMA(21) and bounces

risk_management.entry_zones: Enter on pullbacks to EMA(13) or EMA(21)

strategies.why_works_volatile: MA ribbons visualize trend strength through alignment; crypto's strong trending periods show clear ribbon expansion, offering multiple entry opportunities.

strategies.name: Guppy Multiple Moving Average
entry_conditions: Short-term GMMA (3,5,8,10,12,15 EMAs) crosses above long-term GMMA (30,35,40,45,50,60)
exit_conditions: Short-term GMMA crosses below long-term GMMA
Price closes below all long-term EMAs

risk_management.add_position: Add on each short-term EMA retest

strategies.why_works_volatile: GMMA captures trader and investor sentiment simultaneously; in crypto, GMMA crossovers signal major trend changes with high conviction.

strategies.name: MACD Trend Continuation
entry_conditions: MACD line above signal line and both above zero
exit_conditions: MACD line crosses below signal line

risk_management.add_to_position: Add 25% on each new histogram high

strategies.why_works_volatile: MACD trend continuation captures crypto's tendency for extended moves; histogram expansion confirms momentum persistence ideal for riding trends.

strategies.name: ZigZag Trend Following
entry_conditions: Price breaks above previous swing high
Higher high, higher low pattern confirmed
exit_conditions: Price breaks below last swing low
strategies.why_works_volatile: ZigZag filters noise to show true swing points; in crypto's volatile markets, this helps distinguish meaningful breakouts from random wicks.

strategies.name: Alligator Trend System
entry_conditions: Alligator(13,8,5) jaws, teeth, lips aligned and expanding

risk_management.eating_phase: Only trade when lines clearly separated

strategies.why_works_volatile: Alligator's three-line system adapts to different trend phases; crypto's volatile trends create clear 'eating' phases with aligned, expanding lines.

strategies.name: Hull Moving Average Trend

risk_management.slope_confirmation: Require 3 consecutive bars of same slope direction

strategies.why_works_volatile: Hull MA reduces lag while maintaining smoothness; in crypto's fast markets, HMA responds quicker than traditional MAs to trend changes.

strategies.name: Long Straddle Volatility
strategies.why_works_volatile: Long straddles profit from volatility expansion regardless of direction; crypto's cyclical volatility creates predictable compression-expansion cycles.

strategies.name: Short Strangle Range
entry_conditions: Price in established 10%+ range for 20+ days

risk_management.adjustment: Roll untested side when delta exceeds 0.3

strategies.why_works_volatile: Short strangles capture time decay and volatility contraction; crypto's range-bound periods after violent moves offer high-premium selling opportunities.

strategies.name: Volatility Expansion Break
entry_conditions: Current candle range > 1.5x ATR with volume > 2x

risk_management.trailing: 1.5 ATR trail once 1 ATR profit achieved

strategies.why_works_volatile: Volatility mean reversion is powerful in crypto; periods of low volatility almost always resolve with explosive moves as pent-up energy releases.

strategies.name: Keltner Volatility Squeeze
entry_conditions: Keltner Channel width < 10th percentile of 50 periods
exit_conditions: Price breaks above upper Keltner + volume

risk_management.straddle: Enter both directions, close loser on breakout

strategies.why_works_volatile: Keltner squeezes using ATR adapt to crypto's changing volatility; breakouts from tight Keltner channels often lead to sustained trends.

strategies.name: GARCH Volatility Forecast
entry_conditions: GARCH(1,1) forecast predicts >20% increase in volatility
strategies.why_works_volatile: GARCH models predict volatility clustering; in crypto, GARCH forecasts capture the persistence of volatility shocks better than historical measures.

strategies.name: Volatility Risk Premium

risk_management.roll_strategy: Roll to next month at 21 DTE

strategies.why_works_volatile: Crypto options typically trade with high implied volatility that exceeds realized; selling this premium captures consistent edge in volatile markets.

strategies.name: ATR Position Sizing Trend
entry_conditions: ATR(14) used for dynamic position sizing
Risk per trade fixed at 1% of portfolio
exit_conditions: Trailing stop at 1.5x ATR from peak
strategies.why_works_volatile: ATR-based sizing reduces exposure during crypto's violent periods while increasing it during calm trends, optimizing risk-adjusted returns.

strategies.name: Volatility Stop Trend
entry_conditions: Price above EMA(20) with positive slope
strategies.why_works_volatile: Volatility stops adapt to crypto's changing conditions; widening stops during high volatility prevents premature exits while tightening in calm trends.

strategies.name: Bollinger %B Reversal
strategies.why_works_volatile: %B normalizes price within Bollinger Bands; extreme readings below 0.05 in volatile crypto markets often signal washout bottoms with quick reversals.

strategies.name: Chaikin Volatility Expansion
entry_conditions: Chaikin Volatility(10) crosses above EMA(10) of CV

risk_management.direction_filter: Trade in direction of A/D trend

strategies.why_works_volatile: Chaikin Volatility measures volatility expansion from accumulation; crypto breakouts often confirmed by rising volatility during smart money accumulation.

strategies.name: LSTM Price Prediction
entry_conditions: LSTM model predicts >2% price increase in next 4 hours
Features: OHLCV, RSI, MACD, order book imbalance
strategies.why_works_volatile: LSTM networks capture temporal dependencies in crypto's volatile price action, learning patterns invisible to traditional indicators during rapid moves.

strategies.name: Random Forest Ensemble
entry_conditions: Random Forest (100 estimators) predicts upward move
Feature importance: RSI, Volume, MACD, Bollinger Position

risk_management.feature_engineering: Include on-chain metrics and funding rates

strategies.why_works_volatile: Random Forests handle crypto's non-linear relationships and feature interactions better than linear models, capturing complex volatility patterns.

strategies.name: XGBoost Gradient Boosting
entry_conditions: SHAP values confirm positive contribution from momentum features
No conflicting prediction from RF ensemble
exit_conditions: SHAP analysis shows negative feature contributions
strategies.why_works_volatile: XGBoost's regularization prevents overfitting to crypto's noise while capturing genuine predictive signals in high-volatility regimes.

strategies.name: Reinforcement Learning DQN
entry_conditions: DQN agent Q-value for BUY action > threshold (0.7)
Agent state: price history, position, volatility, P&L
exit_conditions: DQN Q-value for SELL > BUY Q-value

risk_management.take_profit: Agent learns optimal exit through rewards

strategies.why_works_volatile: DQN agents learn optimal policies through trial-and-error in simulated crypto environments, adapting to volatility without explicit feature engineering.

strategies.name: ARIMA-GARCH Hybrid
strategies.why_works_volatile: ARIMA captures linear dependencies while GARCH models volatility clustering; the combination addresses both mean and variance in crypto returns.

strategies.name: Support Vector Machine (SVM)
entry_conditions: SVM with RBF kernel classifies as UP
Support vectors include recent volatile periods
strategies.why_works_volatile: SVM's kernel trick maps crypto's non-linear patterns to higher dimensions where they become separable, capturing complex volatility structures.

strategies.name: K-Means Regime Detection
entry_conditions: Current cluster: high volatility + positive returns
exit_conditions: Cluster assignment changes to MEAN REVERTING or DOWN
strategies.why_works_volatile: K-Means identifies distinct market regimes (trending, ranging, volatile); trading only in favorable regimes improves crypto performance significantly.

strategies.name: Neural Network Pattern Recognition
entry_conditions: CNN identifies bullish chart pattern (flag, triangle, cup)

risk_management.architecture: Conv2D layers for image-like chart input

strategies.why_works_volatile: CNNs recognize visual chart patterns with human-like accuracy but without fatigue; in crypto, this captures patterns forming in volatile price action.

strategies.name: PCA Factor Model
entry_conditions: First principal component (market factor) positive and increasing
Residual from PCA model > 1.5 standard deviations (underpriced)
strategies.why_works_volatile: PCA isolates systematic vs idiosyncratic risk; in crypto, this separates market-wide moves from coin-specific opportunities during volatility.

strategies.name: Isolation Forest Anomaly
entry_conditions: Price action classified as anomaly (isolation depth < 5)
Historical similar anomalies led to 3%+ moves
exit_conditions: Next 3 periods fail to confirm move

risk_management.take_profit: Historical average move from similar anomalies

strategies.why_works_volatile: Isolation Forests detect outliers in real-time; crypto's volatile moves often start as anomalies, providing early entry signals before trends develop.

strategies.name: Spatial Arbitrage
entry_conditions: Price on Exchange A > Price on Exchange B by > 0.5%
Both exchanges have sufficient liquidity (>100k depth)
strategies.why_works_volatile: Spatial arbitrage exploits exchange pricing inefficiencies; crypto volatility creates temporary dislocations as exchanges adjust at different speeds.

strategies.name: Triangular Arbitrage
entry_conditions: Implied cross rate differs from actual by > 0.3%
All three pairs have sufficient liquidity
strategies.why_works_volatile: Triangular arbitrage captures mispricing between related pairs; crypto's fragmented liquidity creates frequent circular arbitrage opportunities.

strategies.name: Funding Rate Arbitrage
entry_conditions: Spot price approximately equal to perpetual
Sufficient margin available for short perpetual
exit_conditions: Funding rate turns negative or near zero
strategies.why_works_volatile: Funding rate arbitrage collects premium from perpetual holders; crypto's volatile sentiment creates extreme funding rates offering risk-free yield.

strategies.name: Statistical Arbitrage (Pairs Trading)
strategies.why_works_volatile: Pairs trading exploits temporary divergence between correlated assets; crypto sector rotation creates frequent mispricings within categories.

strategies.name: Futures Basis Arbitrage

risk_management.rollover_plan: Roll to next quarter 2 weeks before expiry
risk_management.borrow_cost: Lock in borrowing rate if possible

strategies.why_works_volatile: Basis arbitrage captures contango yield; crypto's bullish bias maintains persistent backwardation/contango offering low-risk returns.

strategies.name: Twitter Sentiment Momentum
entry_conditions: Price above VWAP confirming positive sentiment

risk_management.sentiment_source: Use multiple NLP models for consensus

strategies.why_works_volatile: Social sentiment leads crypto price action; viral Twitter trends can drive 20%+ moves in hours, offering early signals before technical confirmation.

strategies.name: Reddit Mention Surge
strategies.why_works_volatile: Reddit drives retail crypto FOMO; sudden mention surges often precede viral pumps, especially in meme coins and low-cap alts.

strategies.name: Fear & Greed Contrarian
strategies.why_works_volatile: Extreme fear signals capitulation in crypto; when fear is maximum, volatility has likely peaked and reversal becomes probable.

strategies.name: Whale Alert Following
entry_conditions: Large wallet moves > $10M to exchange detected
Exchange inflow precedes price by 1-4 hours

risk_management.confirmation: Wait for 2+ whale alerts within 1 hour

strategies.why_works_volatile: Whale movements predict volatility; large exchange deposits often precede dumps while withdrawals signal accumulation in crypto markets.

strategies.name: Google Trends Momentum
exit_conditions: Interest peaks and declines for 2 days
strategies.why_works_volatile: Google Trends captures retail interest before price moves; crypto's viral nature creates explosive search interest that precedes buying pressure.

strategies.name: Head and Shoulders
entry_conditions: Classic H&S pattern: left shoulder, head, higher right shoulder
Neckline support tested at least 2 times
exit_conditions: Price reaches measured move target (head to neckline distance)
RSI divergence at right shoulder resolves
strategies.why_works_volatile: Head and shoulders patterns in crypto have high completion rates; the pattern reflects distribution psychology that plays out rapidly in volatile markets.

strategies.name: Bull Flag Continuation
entry_conditions: Break above flag resistance with volume
exit_conditions: Price reaches measured move (flagpole height + breakout)
strategies.why_works_volatile: Bull flags represent healthy consolidation after explosive moves; in crypto, these patterns resolve quickly with continued momentum.

strategies.name: Double Bottom Reversal
entry_conditions: Two distinct lows at approximately same price level
Second low with bullish divergence on RSI/MACD
Break above middle peak with volume > 2x
exit_conditions: Time exit after 20 periods if no momentum

risk_management.w_pattern: Require W shape, not just two lows

strategies.why_works_volatile: Double bottoms capture exhaustion of sellers; in crypto's volatile markets, these patterns mark significant trend reversals with strong follow-through.

strategies.name: Cup and Handle
entry_conditions: Handle in upper half of cup
Break above handle resistance with volume
exit_conditions: Price reaches cup depth projected from breakout

risk_management.volume_profile: Cup should show declining volume, handle lower

strategies.why_works_volatile: Cup and handle patterns reflect accumulation psychology; crypto's round-number resistance creates natural cup formations before explosive breakouts.

strategies.name: Falling Wedge
entry_conditions: At least 5 touches of each trendline
Break above upper trendline with volume > 1.5x

risk_management.retest: Allow for retest of broken trendline

strategies.why_works_volatile: Falling wedges are bullish consolidation patterns; in crypto, they often form during volatile corrections before resuming explosive uptrends.

strategies.name: Symmetrical Triangle
entry_conditions: At least 4 touches of each trendline
exit_conditions: Price reaches measured move (triangle height + breakout)

risk_management.direction_bias: Trade in direction of prior trend

strategies.why_works_volatile: Symmetrical triangles represent indecision resolution; crypto's volatility creates compressed energy that releases powerfully on triangle breakouts.

strategies.name: Rounding Bottom
entry_conditions: Break above resistance with increasing volume
exit_conditions: Price fails to hold above resistance
strategies.why_works_volatile: Rounding bottoms show gradual accumulation; crypto's sharp bottoms often round quickly before violent reversals as smart money completes accumulation.

strategies.name: Pennant Continuation
entry_conditions: Break in direction of flagpole with volume
exit_conditions: Price breaks opposite side of pennant

risk_management.aggressive_entry: Enter on first pullback after breakout

strategies.why_works_volatile: Pennants represent brief pauses in explosive moves; crypto's momentum persistence makes pennant breakouts high-probability continuation signals.

strategies.name: Inverse Head and Shoulders
entry_conditions: Three lows: left shoulder, lower head, right shoulder
exit_conditions: Price reaches measured move (head to neckline)

risk_management.neckline: Must be clearly defined with 2+ touches

strategies.why_works_volatile: Inverse H&S marks major bottoms in crypto; the pattern captures final capitulation followed by aggressive buying as trend reverses.

strategies.name: Wyckoff Accumulation
entry_conditions: Phase C (Spring): false breakdown below support
Phase D: LPS (Last Point of Support) holds
Sign of Strength (SOS) with volume > 2x average
strategies.why_works_volatile: Wyckoff captures institutional accumulation; crypto's volatile springs shake out weak holders before smart money drives significant rallies.

strategies.name: Triple Indicator Confluence
entry_conditions: Price above EMA(20) with positive slope
strategies.why_works_volatile: Multiple indicator confirmation filters false signals; in crypto's noisy environment, confluence significantly improves win rates.

strategies.name: Multi-Timeframe Alignment
entry_conditions: Daily: Price above EMA(50), bullish trend

risk_management.timeframe_hierarchy: Higher TF direction, lower TF execution

strategies.why_works_volatile: Multi-timeframe analysis ensures alignment across scales; crypto's fractal volatility requires confirmation from multiple time horizons.

strategies.name: Volume-Price Confirmation
entry_conditions: Price breaks above resistance with volume > 2.5x average
OBV (On Balance Volume) at new high
Volume profile shows no major supply above
exit_conditions: Volume drops below average on rally
strategies.why_works_volatile: Volume confirmation validates price moves; in crypto where fake breakouts are common, volume-price confluence separates genuine moves from traps.

strategies.name: ML + Technical Ensemble
entry_conditions: Random Forest predicts UP with > 65% confidence
strategies.why_works_volatile: Combining ML predictions with traditional technicals and alternative data creates robust signals resilient to crypto's volatility shocks.

strategies.name: Divergence + Support Confluence
entry_conditions: Bullish divergence on RSI(14) and MACD
Price at key support (pivot, Fibonacci, volume node)
strategies.why_works_volatile: Divergence at support represents maximum confluence; in crypto's volatile selloffs, these zones offer the highest probability reversal setups.

strategies.name: VWAP + Order Flow Ensemble
entry_conditions: Price crosses above VWAP with volume > 1.5x
Order book: Bid depth > Ask depth by 20%+
Large market buy orders (>5 BTC) detected
exit_conditions: Ask depth exceeds bid depth significantly
strategies.why_works_volatile: VWAP with order flow creates institutional-grade signals; crypto's fragmented liquidity makes this ensemble particularly effective.

strategies.name: Momentum + Mean Reversion Hybrid
entry_conditions: Long-term trend: Price above EMA(50) and rising
Bullish engulfing or hammer at support

risk_management.trend_filter: Only trade pullbacks in established uptrends

strategies.why_works_volatile: Combining trend following with mean reversion captures optimal entry points; crypto's volatile trends create frequent high-probability pullback opportunities.

strategies.name: Volatility Regime Adaptive
entry_conditions: GARCH detects shift to high volatility regime
exit_conditions: Strategy switches to mean reversion mode

risk_management.stop_loss: 2x ATR in high vol, 1x ATR in low vol
risk_management.take_profit: Regime-dependent: 1:3 in high vol, 1:1.5 in low
risk_management.regime_confirmation: Require 3 days in new regime before switching

strategies.why_works_volatile: Adaptive strategies switch between momentum and mean reversion based on volatility regime; essential for crypto's shifting volatility clusters.

strategies.name: Sentiment-Technical Fusion
entry_conditions: Price at major support with bullish candle
strategies.why_works_volatile: Sentiment extremes combined with technical oversold conditions capture major turning points; crypto's emotional trading amplifies these signals.

strategies.name: Ultimate Crypto Ensemble
entry_conditions: Technical: Price above EMA(50), RSI > 50, MACD bullish
ML: LSTM predicts > 3% move with > 70% confidence
Sentiment: Fear & Greed recovering from extreme
strategies.why_works_volatile: The ultimate ensemble combines all signal types for maximum edge; in crypto's complex volatility, multi-factor confirmation provides the highest win rates.
